      • checkAuthorization

        public void checkAuthorization(java.lang.String user,
                               java.lang.String password)
                        throws HttpException
        Checks whether the passed username and password is valid using isUserValid(String) and isPasswordValid(String) and whether the user itself is valid and enabled using checkUser(String, String) User.isEnabled().
        Parameters:
        user - The user ID.
        password - The password.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the checks of the passed credentials failed.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getUsernames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getUsernames(java.lang.String executingUser)
                                             throws HttpException
        Returns all user IDs.

        The executing user must have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        Returns:
        A set of all user IDs.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getUsers

        public java.util.Set<User> getUsers(java.lang.String executingUser)
                             throws HttpException
        Returns all users with their non-sensitive data.

        The executing user must have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        Returns:
        A set of all users.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

        public User getUser(java.lang.String user)
             throws HttpException
        Returns all non-sensitive userdata.
        Parameters:
        user - The user ID.
        Returns:
        The userdata.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the user with this ID does not exist.

      • setUserId

        public void setUserId(java.lang.String executingUser,
                      java.lang.String targetUser,
                      java.lang.String newId)
               throws HttpException
        Modifies the user ID of an existing user.

        The executing user must have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the target user to modify.
        newId - The new ID of the target user.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setUserPassword

        public void setUserPassword(java.lang.String executingUser,
                            java.lang.String targetUser,
                            java.lang.String password)
                     throws HttpException
        Modifies the user password of an existing user.

        The executing user must either have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) or be the target user to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the target user to modify.
        password - The new password of the target user.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • disableUser

        public void disableUser(java.lang.String executingUser,
                        java.lang.String targetUser)
                 throws HttpException
        Disables an existing user.

        The executing user must either have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) or be the target user to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the target user to modify.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setUserEnabled

        public void setUserEnabled(java.lang.String executingUser,
                           java.lang.String targetUser,
                           boolean enabled)
                    throws HttpException
        Enables or disables an existing user.

        The executing user must have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the target user to modify.
        enabled - Whether the target user should be enabled or disabled.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the target user to modify.
        type - The new type of the target user.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String executingUser,
                    java.lang.String targetUser,
                    java.lang.String password,
                    User.Type type,
                    boolean enabled)
             throws HttpException
        Creates a new user with the given data.

        The executing user must have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the new user.
        password - The password of the new user.
        type - The type of the new user.
        enabled - Whether the user is enabled or not.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

             throws HttpException
        Deletes an existing user.

        The executing user must have admin privileges (i.e. must be of type User.Type.ADMIN) to perform this action.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The ID of the executing user.
        targetUser - The ID of the target user.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permissions.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isUserValid

        public boolean isUserValid(java.lang.String user)
        Returns whether the characters in an user ID are valid and the length of the ID is valid.

        Only numbers and letters at least 1 character, maximal 32 characters are allowed.
        [0-9A-Za-z]\{1,32\}

        Parameters:
        user - The user ID to check.
        Returns:
        true when the ID is valid.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isPasswordValid

        public boolean isPasswordValid(java.lang.String password)
        Returns whether the characters in a password are valid and the length of the password is valid.

        No linebreaks, carriage returns, tabs and ':' are allowed, the password must have at least 4, maximal 32 characters.
        [^:\n\r\t]{4,32}

        Parameters:
        password - The password to check.
        Returns:
        true when password is valid.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • checkUser

        public boolean checkUser(java.lang.String user,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Checks whether an user exists and whether the credentials are correct.
        Parameters:
        user - The user ID to check.
        password - The password to check.
        Returns:
        true, when the user exists and the password is valid.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • checkAPIPermission

        public void checkAPIPermission(java.lang.String executingUser,
                               java.lang.String targetUser)
                        throws HttpException
        Checks whether an user has the permission to perform an action.

        When the executing user is the target user, permission is granted. Otherwise, permission is only granted when the user has admin privileges.

        Parameters:
        executingUser - The executing user.
        targetUser - The target user.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permission.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • checkAPIPermission

        public void checkAPIPermission(java.lang.String executingUser)
                        throws HttpException
        Checks whether the executing user has admin privileges.
        Parameters:
        executingUser - The executing user.
        Throws:
        HttpException - When the executing user has insufficient permission.
        Since:
        1.0.0
